website_summaries.verdict: All you need for almost any cleanup task around the home or workshop. A powerful machine that competitors can't top in quality and value.
pros: Built for tough jobs with 16-gallon capacity, 6.5 horsepower, and 7-foot locking flexible hose
cons: The wheels are difficult to put on and may not roll smoothly
Filter clogs quickly in dusty situations

customer_reviews.title: Love the powerful suction
customer_reviews.text: Very good suction. Like the size of the plastic drum. Squat design is stable, Castors are decent. The hose has a rotating collar on the wand connection end which is very handy. The filter is very effective. 2 gripes: 1) The wand extensions should have a clip to hold them on - they tend to come apart as you use them 2) The top doesn't seal as well to the bucket as it could. When carrying it by the handle, if you bump it against you leg or whatever, some dust or whatever is in the drum leaks out
customer_reviews.author: Flyinglow

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh, what can I say? My father passed away in August 2016, and we've been cleaning since October 2016. The basement was a catch-all for 55+ years of accumulated possessions. Once we cleared the debris, we used the WorkShop vac to slurp up everything from nails, concrete dust, and cobwebs. I've used other so-called utility vacuums in the past, but the WorkShop blows them all away! So easy to wheel, and the suction is incredible! I'll never buy on from the "competitor" again!
customer_reviews.author: Suz-Q

customer_reviews.title: the which I purschased separately is a nice addition and lets me easily swap between dry and ...
customer_reviews.text: Several reviewers mentioned having trouble snapping the casters in place. I had no trouble with that at all. Held the plastic foot in one hand and pushed the caster in with a slight twist and pressure. Also, WORKSHOP has now added a foam sleeve for the included filter so that it can be used in wet applications without the need to buy the special foam filter. Having said that, thewhich I purschased separately is a nice addition and lets me easily swap between dry and wet pick up applications. Used it to suck up a small amount of water on the basement floor and it did an excellent job. Much better than my old (25 years) Craftsman vac.
customer_reviews.author: Terry A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Lack of bag really sucks
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this vacuum fully, but not being able to use a bag makes it really frustrating. I hook it up to my tools in my wood shop for dust collection, and I have a dust separator in between the vacuum and tools. It begins to lose suction pretty quickly as the dust just immediately clogged. I’ll try one of the filter bags and see if that helps. Aside from that, it moves an absolute ton of air. Far superior to Shop Vac at a much better price. I like that the hose attaches with a clip, instead of just friction. The onboard tool storage is superior as well.
customer_reviews.author: Epicurus

customer_reviews.title: Dust leaks out
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful vac. However it is poorly designed in that the Top and Bottom parts don't seal properly and dust blows right out of the unit. Maybe the unit needs a seal between top and bottom??? Tried leaving a message in customer support, no response at all. I have reset the top on the main body to no avail, in reality after snapping them together there is plenty on play between the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Beware - can't use dust collection bags
customer_reviews.text: Workshop customer service just informed me that it is impossible to use pickup bags with the WS1600VA Wet Dry Vac. They can be used with the stainless steel WS1600SS, or with the 14 gallon model that looks a bit like this one -- WS1400CA. If I tried to use it for my purpose (EIFS and concrete dust), I'm sure the paper filter would be hopelessly clogged and/or chewed up in short order. Since this functionality is virtually universal, its lack should be prominently disclosed in the description of this so-called "no-nonsense" product. (I'll delete this review if appropriate revision is made and I'm informed.)
customer_reviews.author: Low Command

customer_reviews.title: Suction is awesome. Casters are a joke.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well designed vacuum for shop and home maintenance. The ability to lock the hoses in along with the rubber condom thing which holds the extensions together is genius. Suction is awesome, blower mad driveway cleanup this morning a breeze (no pun intended). So why only 4 stars? The casters......They hang up on everything and can't even roll over its own cord without looking like R2D2 tipping over in that (insert appropriate scene). Thankfully the lid stays on when this occurs but suffice to say its beyond annoying. So I just ordered some 2 1\2" dia casters to hopefully remedy my inpromptu Star Wars reenactments.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Galt

customer_reviews.title: Used this vacuum 3 times with each lime averaging mabe ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this vacuum 3 times with each lime averaging mabe 6 minutes except for the 3rd time it just quit and won’t turn on again and ofcoarse The window has already closed.
customer_reviews.author: SEABASS86

customer_reviews.title: Great Suction, Good Attachments.
customer_reviews.text: Good strong vacuum. Got this for an attic clean up project. Even with two extension hoses attached I had a ton of suction. Attachments work well. Filter did a good job filtering out the dust from the attic. Have not used it for any wet applications, but expect that it would work just fine. I did have to contact customer service and have them send a replacement caster as one of the ones shipped with the vacuum was mismanufactured. They sent the replacement quickly and I was off to the races.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jimerson

customer_reviews.title: I used I used and and to clear out gutters ...
customer_reviews.text: I used I usedandandto clear out gutters. The camera was attached using velcro straps to allow me to see what was in the gutter. The combination allowed the work to be completed without having to use a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Very good shop vac, bus a few downfalls
customer_reviews.text: So this is a really good vacum, super strong suction. There are three issues though. 1- The attachments are terrible. The tubes are tough to keep together, the carpet tools get stuck to the carpet and the hose comes off the base too easy. 2- The thing is LOUD, there no way around it, its super loud 3- The latches that hold the unit to the base suck, they come off very easy. Cord wrapping also sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool it will suck a 5 gallon bucket of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool it will suck a 5 gallon bucket of water dry in 5 seconds. like the lock on hose to vac, hose will not kink, I use it with Dust Right dust separaitor and Workshop 20 foot hose and accessories for dust collection.
customer_reviews.author: Allan G.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a sucking yellow and black beast!
customer_reviews.text: I'm somewhat of a neat freak, and I wanted to be able to keep my garage cleaner than it was. I constantly have leaves, sticks and pebbles that blow into my garage area. I also knew that I had some home improvement projects queued up that might make a mess. So I did my homework about what shop-vac would be a good buy, and ended up with this Workshop Wet Dry Vac. So glad I did! This thing is a behemoth. It sucks like a black hole pulling in small planets. It cleans fast and easy. It was simple to assemble, and it lightweight to carry around, without feeling cheap. I'm super happy with my purchase. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Adam Gynac

customer_reviews.title: 1.2 years and it's dead. Died fully
customer_reviews.text: I liked this vaccum, used in my garage for once a month wood working. But, after a year and a quarter it died. Just gave up. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson Davis

customer_reviews.title: Much better quality than the zombie-brand vacuums
customer_reviews.text: I kinda figured a good wet/dry vac didn't exist anymore since there are so many zombie brands out there (shopvac/craftsman/stanley) that just make garbage and put a recognizable label on it. I've been impressed with the overall quality and power of this unit. I purchased it for car detailing, woodworking, and general rough trade and have been quite happy. I only wish there was a better way to store the cord on the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Teque5

customer_reviews.title: Great buy..excellent shop vac
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is an excellent unit. Its easy to maneuver around, great power and suction. The hose is more flexible than others making it easier to use. The blower feature works well and I have found numerous uses fot it. I like the longer power cord minimizing the need for an extension. Overall a great purchase and I'd sure recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hogriver

customer_reviews.title: Tough as nails, and can suck those up, too.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum works great for picking up just about anything. If it can fit through the hose, off it goes. It's very easy to empty and clean the filter. I got an attachmentfor it and that helped a great deal to make this thing less loud and stinky. I've used this to vacuum up everything from spilled cat litter to dog hair on the upholstery. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Wyldhunt

customer_reviews.title: High performance, BUT
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE - just be aware. It barely fits through a door! Also, assembly is minimum, but the faint of heart need not apply when it comes to putting the casters in the caster feet and then onto the drum. Getting those casters in requires MUSCLE - LOTS of muscle. A ridiculous amount actually for what the function is. But nothing up until this touched the dog hair on the carpets and seats in my car. Once it's assembled it WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: Joan C. Arkuszewski

customer_reviews.title: Defective, didn't run more than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: When I first turned it on and tried it I thought thought wow ... Great suction! But after 10 minutes I smelled a burning smell and the machine started crackling and powering off and would have probably burned out So I turned it off and tried it again later, but had the same result. So at least I was able to return it. Ordered "the beast" hope it works better.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: The mother father sister and brother of all shop vacs!
customer_reviews.text: This shop vac is fabulous!!! With a capital F! It is light and oh so powerful, it pulls easily and holds a lot (I reckon it could hold a bushel of apples if you needed it to!) It is only a little more expensive than the lower end cheezy models, it is attractive (yellow and black) and all kind of oversized and funky. This Emerson shop vac is a winner! Patrick
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Linehan

customer_reviews.title: No filter bag option available as of October 2019
customer_reviews.text: IMPORTANT. This vacuum currently does NOT have a compatible Workshop filter bag option. From Workshop Customer Support October 2019: "Thank you for contacting WORKSHOP Customer Support. Unfortunately, your vacuum WS1600VA is not designed to have filter bags. Only the vacuums with an intake or suction port located on the drum are capable of using filter bags. If you have any further questions or concerns, feel free to call us at 1-888-455-8724 or you may send your reply to info@workshopvacs.com. Regards, WORKSHOP Customer Support"
customer_reviews.author: RoosterValleyKid

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum sucks hard-core! And yeah, that's obviously a good thing. I use it as my main vacuum on all the floors, walls and ceilings in my house. The attachments are amazing and the power on this thing is stellar. It's not a complaint, but be forewarned—anything loose in the area of this thing is going to get sucked up the hose. It's that great!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and thorough
customer_reviews.text: The vac is very powerful and picks up everything (even a corner of the wall-to-wall carpet - I'll need to fasten that down again!). I had issues with the extension tubes coming unlinked from each other as I pulled the head across carpet. Otherwise, I'm satisfied with how well if picks up dust and plaster lumps.
customer_reviews.author: Robert in Tempe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wet/dry vacuum, but still suffers from common wet/dry vac. issues
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum works very well. It has excellent suction power and the hoses and heads fit and work well. I only have a few quips, but they are consistent with my other wet/dry vacuum experience: The rubber sleeve that joins the two rigid hose sections is a bit too flimsy, the hose doesn't swivel very well when vacuuming at an angle, and the filter clogs somewhat rapidly and I have had to purchase a dust cyclone attachment to remedy this. I guess you wouldn't purchase too many filters if vacuum companies fixed this, so I'm not holding my breath for a substantially better product anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Graham R Stetson

customer_reviews.title: Great suction and nice storage for tools on board.
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum, the suction is great, by far the best garage vacuum I have owned. It has plenty of spaces for attachments, I do recommend getting the sound dampener if you intend to use it in a 2 car garage, it makes a difference. I just wish there was a spot for the power cord.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: My most prized garage item.
customer_reviews.text: I use this more than anything else in my garage. I use it for blowing leaves, cleaning cars, cleaning the garage, the patio. It works with water, dust, dirt, rocks, leaves, everything. The filters go bad after 2 years. I love it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one use
customer_reviews.text: This worked one time. Went to use it again yesterday and the motor will not turn on. It worked great he first day I used it but that was a lot of money to shell out for a single use.
customer_reviews.author: BGREM

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned all my house gutters with it, even the ones on level 2
customer_reviews.text: I cleaned all my gutters that I had not clean for 5 years. There was a lot of mud and this sucked it all I bought a 10 feet extension, attached a camera and cleaned the second floor gutters as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Great vac especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was a good purchase. It fits my DeWalt table saw perfectly, as well as other tools without an adapter. Works well. Good power for the price. Large capacity. Solid construction for a plastic vac. Very mobile. I plan to purchase a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W. Swain

customer_reviews.title: Great suction
customer_reviews.text: My husband is thrilled with this. We've tried to do without when the old one died but the cars' carpeting was getting grimy and a few other projects. He said it's the best one we've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: D. BrownTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: It has great suction and when we flooded last week it picked ...
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave this 3 stars is that the wheels would not snap into place and I ordered a dolly to roll it around on. It has great suction and when we flooded last week it picked up all the water rapidly.
customer_reviews.author: Cher Long

customer_reviews.title: Nice to finally find something worth having!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a replacement for an older ShopVac that I bought a few years ago. I needed the larger hose and a large capacity ( I sometimes use this with power tools for dust collection). I have been very disappointed with the choices available to me that match the vacuum I already have. This one is great even though the volume of the canister isn't quite as large as the old ShopVac. For a comparable amount of money this is a very good option.
customer_reviews.author: Robert in Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Why did I put off buying this for so long
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have purchased this long ago. I used to spend 15-30 minutes after each woodworking session cleaning up with my little 2.5hp shop vac. This one hooked directly up to my Dewalt tablesaw and kept it clean and dust free while working.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Cuccia

customer_reviews.title: workshop WS1600VA wet/dry vac
customer_reviews.text: this wet/dry vac will suck the chrome off a trailer hitch, very good suction, but if you are going to use this on your carpet regularly i would advise getting WS25030A carpet and floor nozzle, best wet/dry vac i have owned so far, picks up very well and if you need a blower, this works very well
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks, in a good way. If you crave vac power, this will make you happy. The only con in my opinion is that this thing is super loud. I recommend ear protection.
customer_reviews.author: Mertymertz

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Great Wet/Dry Vac! Assembly was easy and it has great suction. We have only really used it for dry jobs and it has performed outstandingly so far. Zero issues so far and we've been using it pretty regularly for the last couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: JWC

customer_reviews.title: ... you had to buy an extra filter when vaccuming fine dust particles such as joint compound
customer_reviews.text: It did the job however was not aware that you had to buy an extra filter when vaccuming fine dust particles such as joint compound. The dust came shooting out the other end of the dry vac
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas R. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Suction is very good and it comes with a nice variety of tools
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a small 6 gallon Rigid vacuum, this is a HUGE upgrade! Suction is very good and it comes with a nice variety of tools.There appears to be many other accessories, but I doubt I will purchase any. I mainly use this for garage cleanup and the occasional kid spill/mess. It is loud, especially in smaller areas. I pop in ear plugs if I run it for more than a minute or so.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan.G

customer_reviews.title: Works well.  Optimized for liquid.
customer_reviews.text: This unit seems to be optimized for liquid pickup. It will do dry and do it well. But note where the hose inlet is. It is in the top. You cannot use a vac bag with this unit and you need to clean the filter frequently. For liquid pickup this not a problem. When using this vac I do wear hearing protection and use it solely for liquid. Also I note that they do make the same unit with the inlet port in the barrel so they can use filter bags.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Wasmuth, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you’ll love it!
customer_reviews.text: I will be purchasing more! I have used “Shop Vac”, Craftsman, rigid and others but, this is by far the best vacuum yet. It doesn’t suck! Well, it does suck but, um, you know what I mean. Buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Rybeck

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job. I haven't
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my woodshop to clean up saw dust and attach to multiple tools. Does a great job. I haven't, nor do I plan, to use this with water, but for dry applications, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: PACS Master

customer_reviews.title: Did not arrive with any attachments.
customer_reviews.text: The Shop vac did not arrive with all of the attachments listed, it only arrived with the two long extensions, so without purchasing those separately it's effectively useless.
customer_reviews.author: Entrepreneur

customer_reviews.title: Good Price and Good Service
customer_reviews.text: I've used it a few times in the garage and it has done an excellent job, especially with my dog's sheddings. I've also used it to get fur off my pickup truck seats and floorboard. I haven't had a need to use the WET VAC option yet. The only thing I wish it had would be a crevice attachment.
customer_reviews.author: T Frasier

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: As noted elsewhere, it's also quite loud, but no more so than the early 90s vintage Craftsman vac it replaced. Get yourself a good set of ear defenders. Every part of it is very substantial. I like that I can mount the hose on the exhaust port.
customer_reviews.author: Earl M

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described. However, the sharp edges on the hose extension can leave marks on leather so be careful. Also, it doesn’t seem to have as much power as I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: Phil77

customer_reviews.title: Works great great price very loud
customer_reviews.text: Works great Great price Only con is too loud plan on getting earplugs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Very strong! The attachments are kind large so when you get it if they are too large, keep in mind they have a vehicle detailing accessory item they also sell. I picked that up also. Very happy with the vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: This blows away ShopVac (see how I did that?)
customer_reviews.text: Edit: original review: Former ShopVac owner. This product is excellent. WORKSHOP brand will receive my future vacuum purchases. Update: I have been using my Workshop brand vacuum for over 2 years and could not be happier. I am expanding my business into a larger location and buying a second Workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Public user

customer_reviews.title: That is the Infinity of Vacuum Power...
customer_reviews.text: Strong, no surprise, loud but works great as it should. The design is simple no tricks but gets the job done. Industrial enough to recommend to anyone tired of expensive Dyson and don't need delicate suction.
customer_reviews.author: Ryoizard

customer_reviews.title: Love this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum! I use it for cleaning cars, carpet, couches, anything really. Sucks up great, and the added function of being able to blow out air is awesome. Zero complaints with this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin

customer_reviews.title: Wow, strong vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shop vac. Very powerful, nice capacity, alot of filter options.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Price

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: Can not believe how great this is. Great price. Love it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Southern Lady

customer_reviews.title: No wheels?
customer_reviews.text: the wheel didn't go in, afraid to force them!! vacuum great?
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Harker

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller and easy to move around and fast hose connections.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN  LEWIS

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on yard leaves
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on yard leaves Easy to move around. Easy to clean/empty
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: I really like the unique features of this brand (hose saddles for ...
customer_reviews.text: Comparable and competitively priced product. I really like the unique features of this brand (hose saddles for instance) and have ordered another one.
customer_reviews.author: Soots

customer_reviews.title: Missing the dual locking part
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could write a full review on this as it was a gift for my husband. He just returned home from working 4 weeks away. We put it together today and it is missing the most important part the dual locking part that isn’t on the hose? I have been trying to figure out who to contact.
customer_reviews.author: Unsatisfied

customer_reviews.title: only came with (3) wheels.
customer_reviews.text: Good low pressure! not so good on (3) wheels , LOL Please send (1) more wheel and support.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Maile

customer_reviews.title: he said it works great, very good suction
customer_reviews.text: this is my husband's. he said it works great, very good suction, but wishes it had a longer attachment when vacuuming around car seats.
customer_reviews.author: natalie

customer_reviews.title: Great Shop Vac
customer_reviews.text: It has the power I expected. It hooked up to my Dewalt table saw with no problem. I also was able to hook up my orbital sander. I might need to use the rubber sleeve to hook up my Dewalt planer. This is dewalt's design, where they make a 2.5 inch port different on the saw and planer.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas s cameron

customer_reviews.title: powerfull machien
customer_reviews.text: the nut on the bottom of the filter cage was fused tothe plastic shaft and twisted off ,it wont hold a filter now.need a new filter cage.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Baker

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a very old, heavily used Craftsman for both wet and dry usage. I have just used mostly the old Craftsman for a basememt remodel we have going on as this vacumn is huge and not practical at all. It just gets in the way. The suction is not impressive and I have yet to figure out how to remove the filter for wet vac. There is a wierd notch cut out of the attachment I would use most for daily tasks if I were to keep it (which I am not). I don't get this vacumn at all.
customer_reviews.author: koldflow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time comparing wet/dry vacuums. I bought this one. Why? Power. Capacity. Workmanship. Value.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great suction!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great suction, heavy duty, no issues. Stronger then any vaccumed ever used! Better then all the rest!
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good deal and does the job well. I have owned this for a long time and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: He loves it. He was out in the garage for a hour vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: picks up much more sawdust from my table saw than the one it replaces.....
customer_reviews.author: del greening

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. still have yet to use it on any ...
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. still have yet to use it on any wet spills but from the suction power when its being used as a dry vac I assume it's going to work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: the vacuum works great and is a good value
customer_reviews.text: I use it to vacuum my work shop. Also the blower setting is good for blowing pine straw off my driveway
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than shopvac
customer_reviews.text: Large capacity. Extremely powerful suction. Thought out design makes for easy use and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ninjo!

customer_reviews.title: This is simply a great shop vac
customer_reviews.text: This is simply a great shop vac! Does everything youd expect a shop vac of this size and caliber to do with flying colors, i love it.
customer_reviews.author: myleen palasio

customer_reviews.title: has tendency to overheat if used without filter
customer_reviews.text: Has tendency to overheat if used without filter when used as dry vac. This is a bummer as I can foresee huge expenses replacing filter often...
customer_reviews.author: Aouaouche foufa

customer_reviews.title: Great vac!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! more suction than my old shop vac, easy attachment storage.
customer_reviews.author: fintroller

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This product has been great for my outdoors patio area and for the wood workshop. It's heavy duty and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: KJW

customer_reviews.title: ... bit of hot plastic smell at first otherwise it's great.
customer_reviews.text: Had a bit of hot plastic smell at first otherwise it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Just_G_In_The_Lou :-)

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome buy lots of power just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: antonio arias

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Works well. lots of attachments. Very loud. Storing the cord is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: gsl

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Vac and Blower
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price with blower or vacuum power at the flick of a switch. Nice features.
customer_reviews.author: Oso Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Easy to empty with the plug on the bottom. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: chrystal gordon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for big jobs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for big jobs...like getting the last few gallons of water out of the bottom of the hot-tub. The drain at the bottom comes in really handy!
customer_reviews.author: T-Bo

customer_reviews.title: Good big vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift for my husband to use in his woodshop/man cave. He loved it! It is easy to assemble and it’s really big!!! Good product so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Almost too much suction. That is how powerful it is.
customer_reviews.author: Semper Fi

customer_reviews.title: the on/off switch went bad already. I just purchased it in February
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product, the on/off switch went bad already. I just purchased it in February. I can not get a hold of the vendor. I started out rating it a 5, but I am second guessing myself.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Pros :Powerful, light. Cons: Short hose. Blower cannot be used alone You would have to use with the lid. Cumbersome. Ridgit detaches the blower.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Brito big difference with the ones from HF.

customer_reviews.title: Great Vac
customer_reviews.text: It's good, loud as can be but it's not for the library. Haven't used it for water yet, maybe I never will.
customer_reviews.author: flyfisher

customer_reviews.title: Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Used as a vac for my vac system in my shop. Works well. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Great size and suction is strong
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Great size and suction is strong. Well worth what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: PCMOM

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I need a suitable muffler diffuser and dry nozzle for model WS1600VA To be fixed without many couplings
customer_reviews.author: reyad

customer_reviews.title: works great just wish they included hose adapters from 2-1/2 t0 ...
customer_reviews.text: works great just wish they included hose adapters from 2-1/2 t0 1- 1/2 to 1". would make it it more useful with various tools.
customer_reviews.author: Ed J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This vac is fantastic. Well made and works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: justJess

customer_reviews.title: One powerful vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful vacuum, love the fact that I can also vacuum up water. Pretty light also it has wheels on it for easy mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Paw-T70364

customer_reviews.title: Those are so much better than the ones it comes with
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't seem you can put on one of the wet/dry universal filters. Those are so much better than the ones it comes with. But it's great other than that.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband says it is the best vacuum for his workshop! He really likes it!
customer_reviews.author: Debra J. Riggleman

customer_reviews.title: I'm highly disappointed. Now all I have is low suction machine ...
customer_reviews.text: Not very powerful. My cheap $80 vacuum cleaner has way more power and suction than this thing. I'm highly disappointed. Now all I have is low suction machine that takes up a huge space. I'm pretty sure I will be putting this on the curb with a sign that says, "take me, I'm FREE".
customer_reviews.author: Frogmedic

customer_reviews.title: It sucks it blows best vac ever
customer_reviews.text: Best shopvac I've ever used. I would suggest getting a muffler accessory, I got mine from box store for $7 that hooks up to blower. This greatly reduces the high pitched sound that is louder than other vacs I've used. This one drawback is well worth the power and had an easy workaround. I love not having to use bags. Easy to clean and nice fat hose clogs less often than others.
customer_reviews.author: Griffen

customer_reviews.title: great machine, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: We have four dogs, wood floors, and it is heck trying to find something that will help.... FINALLY!!! This product is fantastic, I put it down on the floor and crap 3ft away started migrating towards the hole, that is impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica and Matthew Davis

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: not happy it does not work with their own bags...
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Hofherr Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Well so far I have not been able to try ...
customer_reviews.text: Well so far I have not been able to try it out because I can't put the wheels on. Two different people tried (and might I add, they are somewhat inclined to knowing what they are doing) Neither one were successful in putting it together. Might have to send it back. Any suggestions on how the wheels go on?
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Falconer

customer_reviews.title: Top Of The Line.
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! This is the "Dyson" of shop vacs. Attachments are placed on the body for immediate access. It picks up everything. Do not let small animals and children near or they could be sucked in to the world of Oz.
customer_reviews.author: Armand St Marseille

customer_reviews.title: Better Design so far!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased. Well built and should be much more reliable that other products I have purchased like ShopVac. Have had switches and fan motors fail on all previous. Will see if these can stack up better. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr2woodworking

product_meta.title: WORKSHOP Wet Dry Vac WS1600VA High Capacity Wet Dry Vacuum Cleaner, 16-Gallon Shop Vacuum Cleaner, 6.5 Peak HP Wet And Dry Vacuum
product_meta.description:
This no nonsense 16 Gallon wet dry vacuum cleaner has the power, durability and collection capacity to be the jobsite workhorse. Includes: 6. 5 peak HP shop vacuum cleaner, 7-foot locking hose; 2-1/2-inch accessories utility nozzle, car nozzle, wet nozzle, 2 extension wands, WS21200F standard Qwik Lock vacuum filter, owner's manual. Also compatible with WS22200F Fine Dust Filter and WS23200F HEPA Media Cartridge Filters, and for wet pick-up, the WS24200F Wet Filter.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This no nonsense 16 Gallon wet/dry vac has the power, durability and collection capacity to be the jobsite workhorse. Includes: Vac, Hose, Utility Nozzle, Car Nozzle, Wet Nozzle, 2 Extension Wands, Locking Sleeve, Filter, Owner's Manual.
feature_bullets: 2-1/2-inch x 7-foot dual-flex locking Hose offers 180 degree flexibility at both hose ends. Locking tab keeps hose connected to the wet dry vacuum cleaner during use
Qwik Lock filter fastening system allows quick and easy wet dry vacuum filter changes and contains an auto shut-off float mechanism that helps prevent overflow during wet pickups.
Accessory storage on the feet and top keeps vacuum attachments secure and within reach
This shop vacuum cleaner has a tough copolymer drum to resist dents and cracks, It will not rust and has a large drain for easy liquid disposal. Not compatible with dust collection bags.
Integrated blowing port provides added versatility to this powerful wet dry vacuum cleaner, allowing a user to blow unwanted debris out of garages, jobsites, and driveways.
Largest capacity and most powerful vacuum in the line; picks-up about 1 gallon of water per second
Drain port to easily empty wet messes, and integrated blower for added versatility
7-foot long with 2-1/2-inch diameter hose and 20-foot power cord provide plenty of reach
Includes: vacuum, hose, Qwik Lock cartridge filter, utility nozzle, wet nozzle, car nozzle, two extension wands

specifications.Included Components: Includes: 6.5 peak HP shop vacuum cleaner, 7-foot locking hose; 2-1/2-inch accessories utility nozzle, car nozzle, wet nozzle, 2 extension wands, WS21200F standard Qwik Lock vacuum filter, owner's manual
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars354 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
